title: I'm biased but scrum half is rugby's most important position - Youngs v Genia will shape quarter-final
text:
Ben Youngs has taken some flak for his performances so far this tournament but, in my eyes, it is undeserved. He is a big-game player. The bigger the stage, the better he performs and this quarter-final against Australia probably represents the biggest game of his career.

The pool matches so far have not really allowed Ben to show what he can do.

Almost the hardest games for scrum-halves are against teams that you are expected to beat comfortably. Those games tend to be fractured because the other team are looking to just scrap and spoil. You also don’t know really how they are going to go in defence and they end up doing a lot of random things.

It sounds bizarre but it is almost easier to play...
